intro: Mimusops antsiranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
